example_sentences.context: The advertisement for the concert states that it will include either a popular band or a local artist. One or both of these performances must happen. We are not certain which one is guaranteed. However, according to the promoter, the popular band might not be able to perform.
example_sentences.question: What would be the most appropriate conclusion based on the given context?

choices.choice_1: The concert will necessarily feature the popular band.

choices.choice_2: The concert will necessarily feature both the popular band and the local artist.

choices.choice_3: The concert will necessarily feature neither the popular band nor the local artist.

choices.choice_4: The concert will necessarily feature the local artist.

example_sentences.context: The store's flyer indicates that there will be either a special sale on electronics or clothing. One or both of these sales are definitely happening. It's unclear which one is certain. However, the store manager mentioned that the sale on electronics is not guaranteed.
example_sentences.question: What would be the most appropriate conclusion based on the given context?

choices.choice_1: There will necessarily be a special sale on electronics.

choices.choice_2: The store manager, John, confirmed that there will be no sales at all.

choices.choice_3: There will necessarily be a special sale on both electronics and clothing.

choices.choice_4: There will necessarily be a special sale on clothing.

example_sentences.context: The film critic mentioned that the studio plans to either produce a sequel or a spin-off to the popular movie. One or both of these follow-ups is on the way. We don't know which one is assured. However, the director suggested that a sequel isn't necessarily in the works.
example_sentences.question: What would be the most appropriate conclusion based on the given context?

choices.choice_3: There will necessarily be a spin-off.

choices.choice_4: The studio plans to produce a prequel or a remake.

example_sentences.context: The sports analyst predicted that the team might either win the championship or the runner-up title. One or both outcomes are likely to occur. We aren't sure which one will definitely happen. However, the coach implied that winning the championship is not a certainty.

choices.choice_2: The team will necessarily win the runner-up title.

choices.choice_3: The team will necessarily win both the championship and the runner-up title.

choices.choice_4: The team will necessarily win the championship.

example_sentences.context: The tracking information suggests that the package will either arrive by noon or by the end of the day. One or both of these delivery times is assured. We cannot determine which one is definite. However, the delivery service noted that arriving by noon is not guaranteed.

example_sentences.context: The analysts mentioned that the report will either be published tomorrow or that it will contain new insights, meaning one or both of these outcomes must happen. example_sentences.context: The promotional material states that the movie will either be released next week or will feature a famous actor, meaning at least one of these scenarios is guaranteed.
